revision.text:
{{Wireless embedded system |brand=Arris |model=NVG595 |revision= |upc= |ean= |asin= |price= |est_release_date= |fcc_date=12/10/2013 |manuf_country=Thailand |is_manuf=No |manuf= |manuf_model= |manuf_rev= |availability=now |type=wireless router, analog phone gateway, fiber gateway |fcc_id=GZ5NVG595 |ic_id=2525B-NVG595 |us_id=6EDDL01BNVG595 |pwr_v=12 |pwr_amp=2 |pwr_conn=barrel |cpu1_brand=Broadcom |cpu1_model=BCM63268 |cpu1_cspeed=400 |cpu1_cores=2 |fla1=128 |fla1_brand=Hynix |fla1_model=H27U1G8F2BTR-BC |ram1=128 |ram1_brand=SK hynix |ram1_model=H5TQ1G63EFR-H9C |expansion_if_types=SFP |expansion_sfp_num=1 |jtag= |serial= |wi1_module= |wi1_module_if= |wi1_chip1_brand=Broadcom |wi1_chip1_model=BCM63268 |wi1_802dot11_protocols=abgn |wi1_ant_conn= |wi1_txchains=2 |wi1_rxchains=2 |wi1_sstreams=2 |eth_none= |eth_cpu=true |eth_chip2_brand=Broadcom |eth_chip2_model=BCM54618 |sw_cpu= |sw_brand=Broadcom |sw_model=BCM53125S;BCM53125SKMMLG, <...> P20, <.....> 3 W; |lan_speed=1G |lan_ports=4 |wan_ports=1 |addl_chips=5GHz Power Amplifier Module;Skyworks;SE5017L;SiGe, 5017L, 246DL;2; ,,, 2.4GHz Power Amplifier IC;Skyworks;SE2605L;SiGe, 2605L, 2294L;2; |flags=SFP/GbE WAN, RJ14 port |stock_os= |tp_firmware= |802dot11_protocols=abgn |default_ssid= |default_ssid_regex= |default_ip=192.168.7.254 |default_user= |default_pass= |oui= |oui_eth= }} {{TagLine|Arris NVG595 Fiber Business Gateway}} :[https://www.arris.com/products/nvg595/ Product page] (old)
This would appear to be slated for use for some '''{{Used by service|AT&T}}''' customers.
The '''Arris''' logo, "592170-001 REV []", "EPR4", and "polarc ARRIS Inc. :2013" is silkscreened on the board in the FCC photos.
The WiSoC used in this device has integrated 2.4GHz + 5GHz radios.. :"592171-001-4" is etched onto the bottom of the board.
{{WiFiCert|WFA50808|10/31/2013}}
The power adapter shown in the FCC photos is a '''Motorola''' :branded NBS24G120200VU / P/N: 57961-024-00 :(100-120VAC ~ 50/60Hz, 0.6A -> 12VDC, 2.0A).
*[https://sourceforge.net/arris/nvg595/home/Home/ ''Arris NVG595'' on '''SourceForge'''] :README for building the NVG595 images. This tarball also contains :the Broadcom code drop ''bcm963xx_4.06L.03_consumer_release.tar.gz'', :which was created using Broadcom's source code redistribution process *[http://www.dslreports.com/forum/r29817828-U-Verse-Bussiness-installation-tomorrow-What-equipment-need-to-be-installe ''Arris NVG595'' on '''DSLReports''' forums] :WAN is using the SFP, Wi-Fi is wierd, it has one radio that :can do either 2.4GHz or 5GHz but not both at the same time
